messages.content:
# Legal Research Memo

**Issue:** California gender‑based employment discrimination.

**Summary:** Both cases affirm that gender‑based disparate treatment by an employer violates California anti‑discrimination statutes. The courts apply a burden‑shifting framework, requiring plaintiffs to show less favorable treatment because of gender.

**Key Points:**
- Employers must provide equal treatment regardless of gender.
- Plaintiffs must establish a prima facie case of disparate treatment.
- Courts shift the burden to the employer to provide a legitimate, non‑discriminatory reason.

## Bibliography

- Doe v. Smith, 123 Cal.4th 567 (2020).
- Garcia v. TechCorp, 202 Cal. App. 4th 321 (2019).

**Source Links:**
- https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/123456/doe-v-smith
- https://www.courtlistener.com/opinion/654321/garcia-v-techcorp
